definitions.text: an unforeseen development
examples: events suddenly took an awkward turn

definitions.text: an interpretation of a text or action
examples: they put an unsympathetic construction on his conduct

definitions.text: any clever maneuver
examples: he would stoop to any device to win a point
it was a great sales gimmick
a cheap promotions gimmick for greedy businessmen

definitions.text: the act of rotating rapidly
examples: he gave the crank a spin
it broke off after much twisting

definitions.text: a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments
examples: the wrench to his knee occurred as he fell
he was sidelined with a hamstring pull

definitions.text: a sharp bend in a line produced when a line having a loop is pulled tight
a circular segment of a curve
examples: a bend in the road
a crook in the path

definitions.text: a miniature whirlpool or whirlwind resulting when the current of a fluid doubles back on itself
a jerky pulling movement
a hairdo formed by braiding or twisting the hair
social dancing in which couples vigorously twist their hips and arms in time to the music; was popular in the 1960s
examples: they liked to dance the twist

definitions.text: the act of winding or twisting
examples: he put the key in the old clock and gave it a good wind

definitions.text: turning or twisting around (in place)
examples: with a quick twist of his head he surveyed the room

definitions.text: to move in a twisting or contorted motion, (especially when struggling)
examples: The prisoner writhed in discomfort
The child tried to wriggle free from his aunt's embrace

definitions.text: cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
examples: bend the rod
twist the dough into a braid
the strong man could turn an iron bar

definitions.text: turn in the opposite direction
examples: twist one's head

definitions.text: form into a spiral shape
examples: The cord is all twisted

definitions.text: form into twists
examples: Twist the strips of dough

definitions.text: extend in curves and turns
examples: The road winds around the lake
the path twisted through the forest

definitions.text: do the twist
twist or pull violently or suddenly, especially so as to remove (something) from that to which it is attached or from where it originates
examples: wrench a window off its hinges
wrench oneself free from somebody's grip
a deep sigh was wrenched from his chest

definitions.text: practice sophistry; change the meaning of or be vague about in order to mislead or deceive
examples: Don't twist my words

definitions.text: twist suddenly so as to sprain
examples: wrench one's ankle
The wrestler twisted his shoulder
the hikers sprained their ankles when they fell
I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days
